title: MarketWatch First Take: Google's earnings should be a warning to investors in Facebook and other online-ad companies
text: Google's earnings shortfall is an indication of trouble across the online-advertising industry, and should scare investors in Facebook and other competitors.

title: Big Tech's Stock Drubbing Looks Set to Continue Into Earnings Season
text: Big Tech is looking smaller every day — if you are using stock prices as a yardstick. Tuesday's dismal showing showed more of the same, variations on a theme that has been pretty steady through the past several weeks.

title: Why Meta Platforms (Facebook) Shares Are Falling
text: Shares of several gaming, streaming and social media companies, including Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ: FB), are trading lower amid overall market weakness as stocks continue to fall amid concerns over the potential economic impacts of Fed rate hikes and the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Traders also.

title: 3 Social Stocks Standing Out in Narrowed Field
text: Social media stocks are in the limelight following news that one of their own will soon be taken private. Specifically, Twitter (TWTR) put out a press release late in the day on April 25 confirming that its board of directors had agreed to Elon Musk's offer to buy the social media platform and take it private for $44 billion, or $54.20 a share.

title: Will Global User Growth Aid Meta Platfoms' (FB) Q1 Earnings?
text: Meta Platforms' (FB) first-quarter 2022 performance is likely to reflect a burgeoning international user base and investments on promoting e-commerce.

title: Meta: Buy The Crash, Buy The Metaverse
text: Meta (Facebook) is now down by more than 50% from its ATH in 2021. Shares are back down to their 2018 level. However, Facebook is much cheaper now. The company's stock trades at a rock-bottom of 13 times forward EPS estimates.

title: Musk's Twitter takeover may boost Facebook, Google and Snap ad revenues
text: "Advertisers may shift budgets to other channels given brand safety concerns," JMP analysts wrote in a Tuesday note.

title: Meta Platforms: Bad Technicals Are A Boon For Long-Term Investors
text: Meta's family of apps has ~1.9B DAUs and ~2.8B MAUs. At just 13x P/E, Meta is a no-brainer buy, especially when we factor in the company's buyback program. As the digital advertising giant grapples with a difficult macro environment and Apple's IDFA changes, the expectations and sentiment around Meta are pretty low.

title: Meta (FB) Takes Metaverse to Brick-and-Mortar Retail Store
text: Facebook parent Meta Platforms (FB) unveiled plans to open its first metaverse-themed store. Here's what you need to know.

title: Metaverse an Emerging Concept Now: 4 ETFs to Tap
text: Metaverse is a shared virtual 3D world, or worlds, that are interactive and collaborative.

title: Meta Platforms Stock Before Earnings: Buy or Sell?
text: The social media giant faces macroeconomic headwinds ahead of its earnings report.

title: Could Meta Platforms Stock Help You Retire a Millionaire?
text: The divisive social media stock isn't down for the count yet.

title: Russia fines Meta Platforms over 'LGBT propaganda', Ifax says
text: A Russian court on Tuesday fined Meta Platforms Inc. 4 million roubles ($54,030) for failing to delete posts that contained what it calls "LGBT propaganda", the Interfax news agency reported.
